business.headline: Sensex, Nifty fall for 6th straight day as D-Street's turbulent run continuesAt around 9:21 am, the Sensex was trading at 83,252.86, down 323.38 points, or 0.39 per cent, while the Nifty stood at 25,592.60, lower by 90.70 points. Losses were broad-based, reflecting rising investor caution amid persistent domestic concerns and unsettled global cues.

Income tax refund delays: Why many taxpayers are still waitingComplaints over refunds stuck at the "processing" stage have been trending across social media platforms and grievance portals, bringing renewed attention to the pace of return processing.

PM pitches Gujarat as investment hub; Adani Group, Reliance unveil big-ticket betsPM Modi said that India's growth story is being powered by an expanding middle class and rising purchasing power, alongside structural reforms.

Budget 2026: Will old tax regime survive and should new regime get deductions?Over the past few years, the government has steadily pushed the new tax regime as the default option while keeping the old regime alive for those with existing commitments and deductions.

Drowning in debt: How easy loans are turning into an EMI nightmare for IndiansMonth after month, salaries go to EMIs, essentials shrink, and families realise that what once felt temporary has become the new normal. Read on to understand how this silent debt crisis is unfolding within Indian households.

Is it possible for the US to put a price tag on Greenland?In 1946, the US offered to buy the vast, mineral-rich Arctic island from Denmark for $100 million, an offer that was rejected back then.

Will your PF keep earning interest after you have left job?Changing jobs is common today, but doubts around Provident Fund savings still linger. Many employees worry that their PF stops growing once they leave a job. The truth, however, is very different and often misunderstood.

Tax relief on the cards? What to expect from Budget 2026Changes to tax slabs, a higher exemption limit and a continued push towards the new tax regime helped reduce the tax burden for many families and eased pressure on households in budget 2025.
Sensex closes 605 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; NTPC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 604.72 points to close at 83,576.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 193.55 points to end at 25,683.30.

Gold, silver rates today: What should investors know amid global turmoilGold prices in India moved higher across all major purity levels on January 9. The price of 24K gold stood at Rs 13,871 per gram, up by Rs 71 from the previous session.

Govt ducks IMF's 'C' grade criticism in stunning RTI stonewall: No answers, no fixesOn the estimation of GDP and Gross Value Added (GVA) for the unorganised sector, MoSPI said it follows methodologies outlined in official documents released in 2012 and 2015, both available in the public domain.

Budget 2026: Hoping for a tax makeover? Why you might be disappointed this yearHoping Budget 2026 will finally bring sweeping tax changes? Experts suggest this may not be the year for big announcements or dramatic relief.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO fully booked on Day 1. Should you subscribe?BCCL IPO: The allotment is expected to be finalised on January 14, 2026. Shares are proposed to list on the BSE and NSE on January 16, 2026.

Is sector rotation the real driver of returns in Indian equity markets?Sector rotation in its simplest form is the reaction of the market to shifts in the economic environment. The various sectors are enjoyed at various stages of the cycle.

Sensex falls over 600 points: What's behind the bloodbath on Dalal Street?Around 12:46 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 634.91 points to 83,546.05, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 188.80 points to 25,688.05. Most of the broader market indices also tumbled, reflecting the volatility on Dalal Street.

Still not received your income tax refund in 2026? Here's why it's taking timeWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can be stressful. If your FY 2024–25 income tax refund has not arrived yet in 2026, there are several common reasons behind the delay.

Trump's 500% tariff threat rattles Dalal Street. What should investors do now?Around 11:55 am, the Sensex was down nearly 450 points, while the NSE Nifty 50 had tumbled over 130 points, pushing the benchmark indices deeper into the red after a bruising week.

Budget 2026: Why insurance sector needs more than an FDI boostWith FDI reforms in place, Budget 2026 must prioritise affordability, trust and protection-led incentives to close India's insurance gap and turn reform momentum into real coverage for citizens.

Mutual fund inflows cool off in December, down 6% to Rs 28,054 croreData released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India, or AMFI, showed that inflows into equity mutual funds fell 6% in December to Rs 28,054 crore.

entertainment.headline: Timothee Chalamet, Kylie Jenner's PDA has fans swooning at Golden Globes 2026 Kylie Jenner and Timothee Chalamet attended the 2026 Golden Globe Awards together, with their sweet moments from inside the venue quickly going viral online.

83rd Golden Globes: Priyanka Chopra, BLACKPINK's Lisa unite on stage at awards Priyanka Chopra Jonas and BLACKPINK's Lisa shared the spotlight at the 83rd Golden Globe Awards on Monday as they announced the winner for Best Actor in a Television Drama. Earlier on the red carpet, Priyanka, accompanied by Nick Jonas, turned heads with their coordinated outfits.

Golden Globe Awards 2026: Adolescence sweeps big honours; full winners list here The 83rd Golden Globe Awards 2026 celebrated the best of film and television with major wins for The Pitt, Adolescence and One Battle After Another.

Mana Shankara Varaprasad Garu review: Chiranjeevi's comeback party, logic not invitedRelease Date:Mon Jan 12, 2026 Mana Shankara Varaprasad Garu arrives at the right time, with the right intent. It may not fix logic or reinvent storytelling, but it brings Chiranjeevi back to a space where he looks relaxed, playful, and genuinely at ease.

Thank you world: Hrithik Roshan's birthday note of gratitude to fans melts hearts Hrithik Roshan expressed heartfelt gratitude to his family, friends and fans for their warm wishes on his 52nd birthday, sharing a touching note on social media. The actor also celebrated personal moments with loved ones.

Kriti Sanon sings, grooves with qawwaal Sagar Bhatia at Nupur-Stebin reception Actor Kriti Sanon grooved with Sufi singer Sagar Bhatia on Nupur Sanon-Stebin Ben's reception night. Nupur got married to Stebin on Saturday, in a private ceremony attended by family and close friends.

The Bluff teaser: Priyanka Chopra as Bloody Mary fights pirates, breaks sea rules The teaser of Priyanka Chopra's action-thriller 'The Bluff' was released on January 11, 2026. The film releases on February 25, 2026 on Prime Video.

Haq debuts at No. 1 in India, and No. 2 globally on Netflix Non-English Film list Director Suparn S Varma's legal drama, 'Haq' (2025), has emerged as one of the most closely watched Hindi releases on Netflix at the beginning of 2026. The film featuring Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi debuted at number one spot in India and number two globally after its streaming release.

Ankita Lokhande defends Mahhi-Nadeem bond; Jai Bhanushali thanks her for support Actor Ankita Lokhande, disturbed by trolls commenting on Mahhi Vij and Salman Khan's manager Nadeem, defended their bond, calling Nadeem a father figure to Mahhi, Jai Bhanushali, and their daughter Tara.

Pawan Kalyan conferred Tiger of Martial Arts title, achieves Kenjutsu induction Pawan Kalyan achieved formal Kenjutsu induction, complementing his Fifth Dan and "Tiger of Martial Arts" title. He is the first Telugu-speaking individual inducted into the esteemed Takeda Shingen Clan outside Japan.

Aditya Dhar marks 7 years of Uri; Vicky Kaushal grateful for his faith in him Vicky Kaushal thanked Aditya Dhar on seven years of 'Uri: The Surgical Strike'. He expressed gratitude to Aditya for having faith in his abilities.

Nupur Sanon, Stebin Ben share wedding photos, exchange I do vows on social media Nupur Sanon and Stebin Ben shared pictures from their Christian wedding. The newlyweds shared their wedding vows on social media.

Vijay Deverakonda hails order curbing reviews of Chiranjeevi film on ticketing sites Vijay Dereakonda reacted as ratings and reviews were blocked on ticketing sites for Chiranjeevi's 'Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu' as per court orders. The film is set for a theatrical release on Jnauary 12, 2026.

Queen Yami you are pure craft in Haq: Alia Bhatt after watching film, actor reacts Alia Bhatt recently praised Yami Gautam's performance in 'Haq', which recently premiered on OTT after its theatrical run. The appreciation comes as 'Haq' garnered positive reviews from fans across.

The Raja Saab: 8-minute scene of Prabhas in aged look added amid fan criticism An eight-minute look of Prabhas in director Maruthi's horror-comedy 'The RajaSaab' has been added amid fan criticism. The film theatrically released on January 9, 2026.

Prashant Tamang, Indian Idol 3, dies at 43; family has no suspicion, says police Prashant Tamang, winner of Indian Idol 3, died at 43 after a suspected cardiac arrest. West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee offered her condolences. In the statement recorded by Delhi Police, the late singer's family denied suspicion on any person.

Allu Arjun's birthday wish for director Sukumar takes fans back to Pushpa days Actor Allu Arjun celebrated 'Pushpa' director Sukumar's 56th birthday with a special social media post. He highlighted their long-standing collaboration and the significance of their partnership in shaping both their careers.

His & Hers review: When a marriage, a murder, and a town full of secrets collideRelease Date:Thu Jan 08, 2026 The six-episode adaptation of Alice Feeney's bestseller features suspenseful twists and a strong cast but lacks originality, with predictable plot mechanics and a forgettable finale. It premiered on Netflix on January 8.

Rapper Flipperachi announces India tour after Dhurandhar success. Check dates After his viral song 'FA9LA' from 'Dhurandhar', Bahrain rapper Flipperachi announced his India tour dates. He is set to perform in Bengaluru on March 14.

general news.headline: Looking at strong options: Trump's big warning as over 500 killed in Iran unrest Live UpdatesIran warned it would target US military bases as protests raged nationwide, with rights groups reporting over 500 deaths and more than 10,600 arrests during the regime's most serious unrest since 2022.

India's 2026 space odyssey to begin with mega 16-satellite launch today  Live UpdatesIsro's 2026 space odyssey begins today with the PSLV-C62 mission, a high-stakes celestial ballet of 16 satellites. The launch features India's first orbital AI-image laboratory, and the first on-orbit refuelling model.

I'll kick you: Raj Thackeray warns UP, Bihar migrants against Hindi impositionRaj Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray have joined forces to safeguard Marathi pride in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections. Their rally highlights concerns over Hindi imposition and BJP's influence in Mumbai's political and economic landscape.

Golden Globes 2026 Live: Wagner Moura, Jessie Buckley win Best Actor, ActressHosted by Nikki Glaser, the Golden Globes 2026 has kickstarted at Beverly Hills, Los Angeles. Big shots like Marty Supreme, One Battle After Another and Sinners are among the nominations.

Petrol pump in space, AI lab: All that Isro is launching on PSLVIsro will begin its 2026 odyssey today with the high-stakes PSLV-C62 mission. The launch features India's first orbital AI laboratory and a revolutionary $2 (Rs 180) per minute space cybercafe.

Season's coldest: Delhi shivers at 3.2°C amid northern cold wave alertsDelhi and several northern states are experiencing the coldest temperatures of the season, prompting cold wave alerts and school closures. The India Meteorological Department warns that severe cold and dense fog will continue to impact the region over the coming days.

Bengaluru techie didn't die in fire, was strangled by teen neighbour: CopsPolice have found that Sharmila was strangled to death inside her Bengaluru apartment, after which the accused set the flat on fire to destroy evidence.

Sleeping MPs jolted by citizen-driven campaign on fund use, some rush to edit infoUsing publicly available data, geotagged photos and the MPLADS dashboards, citizen sleuths are demanding accountability from the MPs across India. The Ye Theek Karke Dikhao campaign is exposing and lauding MPs. Which MP did the best? Here's how you can check your MP's work. It is just a click away.

All eyes on Priyanka Chopra as she brings blue glam to the Golden Globes in DiorPriyanka Chopra Jonas wore a custom blue Dior gown featuring an intriguing mix of metallic and matte details at the 2026 Golden Globe Awards.

Truck drives into anti-Iran regime rally in Los Angeles, several injuredThe incident unfolded outside the Wilshire Federal Building, where a large rally had been organised in support of ongoing protests in Iran. Thousands of people had gathered for the demonstration, which was scheduled to begin at 2 pm local time.

The one wedding hire I'd recommend: A bridal shadowNew to the idea of bridal shadows? The term might sound unfamiliar, but the role has always existed; it's only now getting a more professional identity.

They stay at his mom's Gurugram placeVirat Kohli combined a match-winning 93 with a touching revelation off the field, saying he sends every award from his international career to his mother's Gurugram home. Head of 6 gangs, spanning 12 states, arrested in SuratSurat police have arrested Abid Ali, alias Raju and Rahman Daku, a notorious criminal from Bhopal, whose network spanned six gangs across 12 states. Wanted in multiple states, he used his gangs to target senior citizens, commit robberies posing as police, and manage stolen goods.

Bhopal priest fulfills wife's dream to become a cop. She files for divorceA Bhopal priest who supported his wife in fulfilling her dream of joining the police now faces divorce, with the woman citing discomfort over his traditional shikha, dhoti-kurta and "pandit-like" behaviour as the reason.

Suspected Pak drones entered J&K, Indian forces on high alertAll the flying objects were seen entering Indian airspace from across the border, hovering briefly over sensitive locations, and then retreating back towards Pakistan.

Is this Jennifer Lawrence's boldest look yet? A naked dress at Golden GlobesJennifer Lawrence made an appearance at the Golden Globes in a sheer, barely there gown which seems to have grabbed a lot of attention.

Trump threatens Cuba with oil cutoff, Havana slams US' 'criminal' behaviourTrump said Cuba had survived for years on "large amounts of oil and money from Venezuela," claiming Havana had provided security support to Venezuela's leadership in return. Cuba rejected Trump's remarks, accusing the US of acting in a way that threatens international stability.

German Chancellor Friedrich Merz begins maiden India visit, to meet PM todayGerman Chancellor Friedrich Merz landed at the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport in Ahmedabad on Sunday night at the start of a two-day visit, undertaken at the invitation of Prime Minister Modi. The two leaders are set to meet later today in Ahmedabad.

Iran dismisses reports of Indian nationals arrested during unrestIran denies claims that Indian citizens have been arrested amid the unrest, calling the information false. The All India Medical Students Association and the Federation of All India Medical Associations also confirmed that Indian students in Iran are safe.

World will end in 2026: Why doomsday predictions are spreading this yearFrom Baba Vanga, known as the Nostradamus of the Balkans, to new freshly minted prophets who come and go on social media to harmless memes and jokes, everyone seems to be predicting the end of the world in 2026. They are either predicting a calamity of biblical proportions or a world war. Why so?

sports.headline: Harshit Rana opens up on India grooming him as an all-rounder, eyes ODI No.7 role IND vs NZ: Harshit Rana revealed India are grooming him as an all-rounder in the ODI setup. They stay at his mom's Gurugram place Virat Kohli combined a match-winning 93 with a touching revelation off the field, saying he sends every award from his international career to his mother's Gurugram home. Hacker hits Bruno: Man United react after rogue X posts on INEOS, Bonnie Blue A series of erratic posts appeared on Bruno Fernandes's X account late on Sunday before being deleted. Manchester United later confirmed the account had been hacked, urged supporters not to engage with the content.

Raphinha repays Hansi Flick's faith with Super Cup final brace vs Real Madrid Raphinha repaid Hansi Flick's faith with a match-winning brace as Barcelona edged Real Madrid 3-2 to claim the Spanish Super Cup. His goals proved decisive in a dramatic final marked by late pressure, a red card and relentless Madrid attacks.

Unburdened, unlocked: Virat Kohli reinvents his ODI game in fearless final act India vs New Zealand: No longer weighed down by milestones or expectation, Virat Kohli now bats on instinct and intent. Since returning to ODI action last October, he has scored at a strike rate of 103, significantly higher than his career strike rate.

KL Rahul and perks of batting at No.6: India star explains advantage of role KL Rahul explained the perks and pressure that comes with batting for at No.6 and playing the finisher's role for the side. Rahul helped India beat New Zealand in the Baroda ODI.

Jemimah dejected after DC lose thriller vs Gujarat: Tough pill to swallow Jemimah Rodrigues was dejected after the Delhi Capitals lost back-to-back games following their four-run defeat to the Gujarat Giants on Sunday in Navi Mumbai.

Happens to MS Dhoni too: Virat Kohli reveals a unique problem because of fans' craze Virat Kohli opened up on the fan craze for him during the Baroda ODI against New Zealand on Sunday, January 11 and compared to the situation to the one MS Dhoni faces during CSK matches in the IPL.

Sophie Devine's 95, last over heroics hand Delhi Capitals back-to-back defeats WPL 2026, DC vs GG: Delhi Capitals slumped to back-to-back defeats in the tournament after the Gujarat Giants beat them by four runs on Sunday in Navi Mumbai.

IND vs NZ: After Rishabh Pant, India lose Washington Sundar for New Zealand ODIsFollowing the injury of Rishabh Pant, India was dealt with another blow as Washington Sundar was ruled out of the remainder of the New Zealand series due to a side strain.

India vs New Zealand 1st ODI: Kohli's 93, Dropped Catches & Rahul Seal Tense Win | IND-NZ ODIIn a special report, India Today's Consulting Editor, Nikhil Naz, breaks down India's tense four-wicket victory over New Zealand in the first ODI at Baroda. Naz points out that while India appeared to be cruising towards an easy win, the match became a '50-50 sort of an encounter' following the dismissal of Virat Kohli for 93. He states, 'While he was there on the crease, it looked like India are in cruise control, driver's seat, cruising to an easy win.' Naz also highlights that dropped catches by an otherwise proficient New Zealand side proved critical. He notes that the visiting team was not at full strength, with several key players missing, yet they still managed to give India a tough fight before KL Rahul finished the match.

IND vs NZ: India survive scare in 301 chase after Virat Kohli's rare 90s blunderIndia survived an almighty scare from New Zealand in Baroda as Virat Kohli's 93 was enough to seal the win and take a 1-0 lead in the series. Harshit's all-round performance and KL Rahul's calmness came in clutch for the hosts as Kyle Jamieson's four-wicket haul got the Blackcaps interested in the game.

Who is Nandini Sharma? Delhi Capitals bowler scripts history with WPL hat-trickWPL 2026, DC v GG: Nandini Sharma became the first Delhi Capitals' bowler to take a hat-trick in the history of the tournament. She finished with figures of 4-0-33-5 after dismissing Kanika Ahuja, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, and Renuka Singh in the last over.

Sophie Devine struck by 90s curse again, falls short of historic WPL hundredWPL 2026, DC vs GG: Sophie Devine fell short of a Women's Premier League century again, scoring 95 off 42 balls against Delhi Capitals before succumbing to the 90s curse.

Sanjay Bangar calls Hindi national language during commentary, gets reality checkIND vs NZ, 1st ODI: Sanjay Bangar sparked backlash after saying he preferred the "national language" during commentary, with many pointing out that the Constitution recognises 22 languages and India has no national language.

Liverpool's Bradley set to be out for the season after knee injury vs ArsenalConor Bradley will undergo surgery and faces an uncertain timeline for return after suffering a knee injury during Liverpool's 0-0 Premier League draw with Arsenal. The defender was stretchered off following an off-the-ball incident in stoppage time, with media reports indicating the injury could be season-ending.

New year, same Virat Kohli: Indian great reaches new milestone, just behind TendulkarVirat Kohli started 2026 in impressive fashion as he became the second-highest run-getter in international cricket during the first ODI between India and New Zealand in Baroda on Sunday, January 11.

Ole back at the wheel? Can Solksjaer really rescue Manchester United?Ole Gunnar Solksjaer is edging close to a return to Manchester United as their interim manager till the end of the season. While he did some magic as the temporary boss in his first stint, can he do the same at United yet again?

DC vs GG Highlights: Capitals slump to back-to-back losses as Giants win thrillerDelhi Capitals Women (DC) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GG) Highlights: Laura Wolvaardt scored 77 runs, but her efforts went in vain as the Delhi Capitals lost to the Gujarat Giants by four runs in Navi Mumbai.

Bangladesh umpire officiates in India while team cites security fears for T20 World CupBangladesh umpire Sharfuddoula Saikat is officiating in the ongoing India-New Zealand ODI series despite Bangladesh's security concerns about India. This situation raises questions over the BCB's stance amid IPL controversies and government actions.

An Se Young carries red-hot form into New Year, wins Malaysia Open South Korea's An Se-young secured her third consecutive Malaysia Open women's singles title. After finishing 2025 with four titles in a row, the reigning Olympic champion picked up where she left off last year. An will now look to defend her India Open crown in New Delhi later this week.

VHT 2025-26 quarterfinals: Schedule, teams, livestreaming detailsSarfaraz Khan and Devdutt Padikkal headline the quarterfinal clash between Mumbai and Karnataka, while Uttar Pradesh meet Saurashtra in the other quarter-final on January 12. The second set of last 8 games will see Punjab face MP and Delhi take on Vidarbha.

Rohit, Kohli's 'out of the box' felicitation has social media in splitsIndia vs New Zealand 1st ODI: Superstars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were felicitated by the Baroda Cricket Association on Sunday, January 11. The unique manner of the celebration left the fans in splits.

Did Sabalenka propose to her boyfriend? World No.1 steals show after Brisbane winWorld No.1 Aryna Sabalenka sparked social media buzz about a possible engagement after joking about boyfriend Georgios Frangulis during her Brisbane International win on Sunday.

Rickelton's KL Rahul moment: South Africa star explains 2nd SA20 hundred celebrationRyan Rickleton admitted that he drew inspiration from KL Rahul's Kantaara celebration after getting his second hundred in the ongoing SA20 2026 season. Rickleton scored 113 off 60 balls to help MI Cape Town beat Jo'burg Super Kings.

Uno reverse: Shafali, Jemimah front men's T20 World Cup promo, ad goes viralStar Sports has launched a first-of-its-kind promotional campaign for the men's T20 World Cup 2026 featuring India's women cricketers, with Shafali Verma delivering a punchline that has since gone viral on social media.

Pakistan ready to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches: ReportPakistan has reportedly offered to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup 2026 matches amid security concerns over travel to India, as the ICC weighs venue options while Bangladesh await a final decision.

Nicola Carey for T20 World Cup? Ex-Australia captain backs MI star amid incredible WPLFormer Australia captain Alex Blackwell has backed in-form Mumbai Indians all-rounder Nicola Carey for a Women's T20 World Cup recall after her standout WPL and WBBL performances.

Unjustifiable: Ex-cricketer slams constant snubbing of Arshdeep, Shami and AxarPriyank Panchal slammed the Indian team management for the constant snubbing of Arshdeep Singh and season campaigners like Axar Patel and Mohammed Shami for the ODIs against New Zealand. Arshdeep wasn't picked for the first ODI against New Zealand.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
